Job Title: Tax Analyst

Location: North Palm Beach, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Requisition ID: 79467

NextEra Energy Resources is the world's largest generator of renewable energy from the wind and sun, and a world leader in battery stor******. We provide energy-related products and services that grow our economy, protect the environment, support our communities and help customers meet their energy needs. We are leading the decarbonization of the U.S. economy with our goal to reach Real Zero carbon emissions from our operations by 2045 while improving customer affordability and reliability. Are you interested in creating a cleaner environment for future ******s? Join our world-class, innovative team today.

Position Specific Description

The Tax team at NextEra Energy is responsible for supplying information to support the compliance, planning and forecast functions of the tax organization. The team focuses on ensuring accurate, complete and timely information is provided and readily available to support the company’s compliance and strategic goals. The effective use of technology, products, data man******ment, and analytics is key to the success of the fixed asset team. On a day to day basis we are involved in meeting business needs by providing detailed fixed asset information from both a historic and forecast view.

We are looking for a dynamic professional with an interest in accounting data and working in a capital-intensive environment. The individual must have the ability to understand business requirements and translate those into delivering solutions that meet the business needs. The ideal candidate should be highly motivated and have a continuous improvement mindset with a natural drive to take ownership of the deliverables.

 Excited to work with Tax team that delivers beyond man******ment expectations Ready to collaborate with team on deliverables and man******ment directives Maintain and monitor assigned tax workpapers required on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis including but not limited to Fixed Asset related accounts including costs, depreciation, transfers, gain/loss on disposal, and asset retirement obligations Provide reports and analysis as needed for compliance, tax accounting, forecast and tax planning needs Work cross functionally with all areas of the tax organization to support the account reconciliation process by providing fixed asset roll-forward and balance sheet account reconciliations E******r to develop a technical expertise for fixed asset accounting Identify and implement improvements to existing processes through use of technology and innovation Ability to quickly establish priorities and meet all assigned deadlines related provision, compliance, and regulatory processes Work cross functionally with other departments regarding income statement, balance sheet and income tax expense accounts and reconciling variances Identify and implement improvements to existing processes through use of technology and innovation Effective communication within tax organization to ensure efficient process for meeting business requirements

Must Have Skills

 Prior experience in managing projects Prior experience in accounting Ability to understand business requirements and transform them into solutions that deliver timely and accurate results Excellent analytical, problem solving and data analysis skills. Skilled in using Microsoft office tools: MS Excel, Power Query, Power Point, Word. Excellent communication skills (verbal and written).

Desired Skills

 Prior experience with financial accounting and tax processes and systems such as SAP ECC, SAP BW, PowerPlan, BNA, CorpTax, ONESOURCE Tax Provision, etc. Knowledge of Energy & Utilities domain and processes. Exposure to automation and process automation tools such as RPA, Alteryx, Power Automate etc. Exceptional analytical, communication and technical skills Strong experience with technology and automation Experience in Public Accounting or with large corporate processes related to accounting.

Job Overview

This job is responsible for moderate to complex projects associated with the maintenance of tax records and the preparation of all or specifically assigned tax returns, separate company corporate income tax and partnership tax returns, consolidated tax returns and related reports.

Job Duties & Responsibilities

 Prepares and reviews federal/state/local income tax returns, schedules, extensions and payment estimates in line with the company’s tax filing calendar Conducts financial and economic analyses, developing and preparing the organization’s financial plans and budgets and interpreting financial reports and tax returns Researches inquiries from government ******ncies regarding filings, compliance, and other claims Prepares tax calculations to support tax controversy analyses Conducts tax assumptions in project models Performs other job-related duties as assignedRequired Qualifications Bachelor's Degree Experience: 2+ years Qualifications Certified Public Accountant (CPA) Master's - Accounting / Finance Tax Compliance Tax Research

Employee Group: Exempt

Employee Type: Full Time

Job Category: Finance, Accounting & Business Analytics

Organization: NextEra Energy Resources, LLC
